data.title: Great Places to Find Live Music in Delco
data.meta_description: Delco’s live music scene is as dynamic and diverse as Delco itself. Home to numerous venues that regularly showcase local and regional talent, your options are anything but limited when it comes to places offering good times and good tunes
data.text:
Delco’s live music scene is as dynamic and diverse as Delco itself. Home to numerous venues that regularly showcase local and regional talent, your options are anything but limited when it comes to places offering good times and good tunes.

Lansdowne Folk Club

For 29 years, the all-volunteer Lansdowne Folk Club has brought folk, acoustic and blues music to the heart of Delco. The music happens in the ballroom of the Twentieth Century Club, an arts and crafts style building listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

Image courtesy Photography by JohnKellyGreen.com

Towne House

Boasting a beautiful restaurant, Irish pub, live entertainment venue, open air courtyard and sophisticated cocktail lounge, the space comes to life with a wide range of artists and performances.

WaR3house3

Bringing the definition of re-purposing to life, War3house3 is an antique store by day and a performance venue at night. An eclectic mix of industrial and decorative arts fills the space that is home to live performances on Saturday nights; bringing a dose of the unique and odd – in the very best way! – to the suburban hamlet of Swarthmore.

Streetlight Kitchen & Bar

Located adjacent to the iconic Delco landmark, Drexelbrook, Streetlight Kitchen & Bar offers delicious comfort foods, an extensive drink menu, creek side views from its (seasonal) outdoor patio and a rotating list of entertainment that includes a live DJ and local favorites, Dueling Piano Dudes.

118 North

This Wayne music venue has gone straight to the top of the charts. With a calendar featuring local and national artists, a long list of options at the bar, and a menu packed-full of Americana cuisine, this place was built to rock the Main Line. With state-of-the-art sound and lighting in an intimate setting, guests enjoy a top-notch music experience within the friendly atmosphere of a favorite neighborhood bar.

Image courtesy 118 North/Facebook

Media Arts Council

Media Arts Council has been a leader in the Delaware County performance arts scene and recently relocated to a new home on Media’s bustling State Street. Programming includes professional musicians, youth concerts, open mic nights, singer/songwriter showcases and more!

Kelly Center for Music, Arts, and Community

Artists from around the area showcase and share their talents with sounds ranging from jazz & blues to folk and singers and songwriters at Havertown’s Kelly Center. The venue also hosts a wide variety of events such as book club discussions, comedy open mics, holiday-themed events, and art shows.

Community Arts Center

Explore the relationship between visual art and music at Community Art Center’s Friday Night Live Music Series. During these intimate concerts, local artists create visual art inspired by and responding to the music. Concerts are BYOB.

Jamey’s House of Music

Jamey’s House of Music is an intimate venue featuring superlative sound in a comfortable listening room. Guests can also enjoy eclectic fare and ales on tap from Crooked Eye Brewery. Open for Thursday Night Jazz Jam, Friday and Saturday night concerts, and Sunday Blues Brunch.

Image courtesy Jamey’s House of Music/Facebook
